title: Sweden ready to let got of budget surplus
summary: The rule was adopted after the crisis of the early 1990s. Faced with enormous need for public investment, a majority of parties want to replace it with the balanced budget principle.

title: Demonstrations in France praise Gisèle Pelicot's courage in harrowing drug and rape trial
summary: Since the beginning of the extraordinary trial, during which Pelicot has faced 51 of her alleged rapists, she has been applauded for her composure and decision to keep the hearings public – after the court initially suggested that they be held behind closed doors.

title: Trump is 'cruel,' says Harris about abortion in Georgia ; Trump goes off script in Pennsylvania
summary: VP and democratic candidate was joined in Atlanta by hometown music icon Usher after appearing with Lizzo in Detroit. Republican candidate Trump campaigned in Pennsylvania where he slammed Harris as 'crazy' and added profanity.

title: Biden, Macron, Scholz and Starmer split over inviting Ukraine to join NATO
summary: The subject is at the heart of the 'victory plan' Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky presented to his allies.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu accused Hezbollah of trying to kill him after a drone hit his family home
summary: The Lebanese group, armed and financed by Iran, did not acknowledge the attack, but late on Saturday Iran's United Nations mission said 'this action was taken' by Hezbollah.

title: Netflix: 'The heist of the century'
summary: On Thursday, the platform announced revenue approaching $10 billion. In less than 15 years, Netflix has transformed a relatively small-scale, national business – television – into an extremely profitable global venture, writes Le Monde's Philippe Escande.

title: Cuba gets some electricity back after major blackout
summary: About half of Cuba was plunged into darkness on Thursday evening, followed by the entire island on Friday morning after the plant failed.

title: The UN warns that Palestinians are enduring 'unspeakable horrors' in north Gaza
summary: 'Appalling news from northern Gaza where Palestinians continue to endure unspeakable horrors under siege by Israeli forces,' the UN's acting humanitarian chief Joyce Msuya said on X, Saturday. 'These atrocities must stop.'

title: Donuts, sweet beer, cheese bites: French eating habits are turned upside down by marketing
summary: This is the major trend at the international food show opening in Paris on October 19: The industry has seized on French people's supposed desire for 'pleasure' to come up with high-calorie innovations with a strong focus on fast food and snacking.

title: Harris and Trump prefer influencers and podcasters to mainstream media
summary: Both US presidential candidates have opted for minimal presence on TV and in the traditional press. Instead, they are focusing their campaigns on more targeted media, where they can avoid pushback.

title: War in Ukraine: Deployment of North Korean troops would be an unprecedented escalation
summary: According to South Korean and Ukrainian intelligence services, Pyongyang plans to deploy 10,000 troops to fight the Ukrainians. The West has not confirmed the information but is expressing deep concern.

title: At least 73 killed in Israel strike in territory's north, according to Gaza rescuers
summary: Israel said it struck a 'Hamas terror target.' Prior to the latest strike, the operation had already killed more than 400 people in north Gaza, a spokesman for the civil defense agency told AFP earlier on Saturday.

title: Russian victory in Ukraine would bring 'chaos,' French Foreign Minister warns
summary: Jean-Noël Barrot's comments come as Ukrainian and South Korean intelligence services report that North Korean troops will be deployed in Ukraine in support of Russia.

title: The ultimate sartorial gentrification: Traditional blue workwear in the office
summary: Emblematic blue-collar garments are now worn by workers of the service sector, giving off an air of fake authenticity.

title: French government displays its hardline immigration stance
summary: The prime minister and interior minister's visit to the French-Italian border on Friday was an opportunity to confirm the rapprochement with Giorgia Meloni's position and to highlight the 'new state of mind' in Europe on the fight against immigration.

title: Flooding in France: 'Global warming is generating even more severe episodes of heavy precipitation'
summary: Climate change means more extreme dry weather and more extreme wet weather, explains climatologist Aurélien Ribes.

title: Boeing and workers union reach tentative deal to end strike
summary: Members of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, on strike since September, are to vote on the deal next Wednesday.

title: Crickets as roommates and 'living' toilets: Welcome to the 'apartment of the future' in a Paris suburb
summary: An engineer and a designer are testing a quasi-autonomous lifestyle in the western Paris suburbs to simulate what sustainable urban living could look like in 2040.

title: Moldova votes to confirm or reject its European path
summary: The presidential campaign, which is doubling as a referendum on EU membership, has been troubled by controversy over the impartiality of the electoral process and a massive disinformation operation orchestrated by Moscow.

title: In Kyiv, Zelensky's 'victory plan' is met with reservations
summary: Opposition politicians criticize the Ukrainian president for making the country's future too dependent on foreign allies.

title: Dominique Pelicot's second tumultuous interrogation at French mass rape trial
summary: On Friday, October 18, the main defendant continued to accuse his 50 co-defendants in a series of questions that provoked a heated debate and underlined the common goal between him and the victim: to get everyone convicted.

title: In Lebanon, Palestinians refugees have 'nothing left to lose'
summary: Following the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, representatives of different political camps in the Beddawi Palestinian refugee camp in northern Lebanon share a determination to continue 'resisting' Israel.

title: At tribute for cyclist killed in Paris: 'What happened to Paul isn't an isolated case'
summary: Several hundred cyclists gathered at Place de la République on Saturday for a tribute to Paul Varry, the 27-year-old cyclist crushed by an SUV driver on Tuesday.

title: Is Gen Z neglecting work, or are their older colleagues too quick to judge them?
summary: While numerous research studies are deconstructing stereotypes about new generations' relationship to work, the corporate world seems baffled as to how to manage its youngest employees.

title: Back in the pool, French swimmer Léon Marchand wins three World Cup titles in Shanghai
summary: The French champion competed in swimming's short-course World Cup in Shanghai, in his first meet since taking the Paris Olympics by storm.

title: The DZ Mafia, a French drug enterprise turned criminal brand with mafia ambitions
summary: The Marseille-based gang, highly attractive to young recruits, has grown in power over the last few months. It has diversified its activities, offering services ranging from managing drug-dealing corners to subcontracting murders.

title: Strikes intensify in Lebanon, Gaza and Israel after death of Hamas leader Sinwar
summary: Families of Israeli hostages call for a deal after Yahya Sinwar's killing. Missile and rocket fire continues unabated between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title: Jewish leader Yonathan Arfi: 'For the first time since the Second World War, anti-Semitism is being fuelled at all levels of French society'
summary: The president of the Representative Council of French Jewish Institutions looks back at the shockwaves of the Hamas attack in Israel, and the anti-Semitic incidents that followed.

title: Europe's Euclid probe unveils the first pages of its sky atlas
summary: In revealing the initial piece of its grand map of the universe, the European Space Agency's mission is attempting to unravel the two great mysteries of cosmology: dark matter and dark energy.

title: Has France really become more right wing?
summary: Political scientist Vincent Tiberj, interviewed with ex-education minister Jean-Michel Blanquer, explains that the far-right Rassemblement National party's electoral surge doesn't reflect a rightward shift in French society.

title: Our selection of the 15 best apple tarts in France
summary: Cinnamon or caramel, rustic or very thin crust, vegan or sugar-free, here's our selection of the best apple-based desserts around the country.

title: France says it has received assurances over sale of painkiller maker to US investment fund CD&R
summary: The proposed sale turned into a real political issue because Opella's products include Doliprane, the best-selling medicine in France.
